thread.title: Busline League pitch playoffs press on, championships on-deck
thread.title_full: Busline League pitch playoffs press on, championships on-deck

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Busline League pitch playoffs press on, championships on-deck
text:
The following is a breakdown of each division, including championship dates and times: 
Coed 
Thus far in prelim action, No. 6 St. George defeated No. 11 Troy Howard of Belfast, No. 7 Vinalhaven beat No. 10 Nobleboro and No. 8 Camden-Rockport beat No. 9 South Bristol. 
In quarterfinal play, No. 3 Appleton knocked out No. 6 St. George, No. 4 Jefferson defeated No. 5 Bristol and top-seeded Hope beat No. 8 Camden-Rockport. 
One final quarterfinal remains to be played as No. 2 Lincolnville hosted No. 7 Vinalhaven on Monday, Oct. 19 at 3:45 p.m. in Lincolnville. 
In one semifinal, top-seeded Hope will host No. 4 Jefferson on Tuesday, Oct. 20 at 4:15 p.m. In the other, No. 3 Appleton will either travel to face No. 2 Lincolville, or host No. 7 Vinalhaven, likely Tuesday, Oct. 20, depending on the outcome of Monday's playoff encounter between the Lynx and Vikings. 
The coed championship game will be on Thursday, Oct. 22 at 3:30 p.m. at Point Lookout in Northport. 
Boys 
In prelim action, No. 8 Searsport defeated No. 9 Wiscasset. 
In quarterfinal play, No. 3 Medomak netted a 4-0 win over No. 6 Oceanside, No. 2 Camden-Rockport 8th defeated No. 7 Great Salt Bay and No. 4 Camden-Rockport 7th beat No. 5 Woolwich 2-1 in double-overtime. 
One final quarterfinal remains to be played as top-seeded Troy Howard hosted No. 8 Searsport on Monday, Oct. 19 at 3:45 p.m. 
If the Lions win, they will host No. 4 Camden-Rockport 7th, while if the Vikings win, they will travel to face No. 4 CRMS 7th in a semifinal game, time and date to be determined. 
The other semifinal will see No. 3 Medomak travel to face No. 2 Camden-Rockport 8th on Wednesday, Oct. 21 at 3:15 p.m. 
The championship game will be on Tuesday, Oct. 27 at 3:30 p.m. at Point Lookout in Northport. 
Girls 
In prelim action, No. 8 Searsport beat No. 9 Boothbay. 
In quarterfinal play, No. 4 Medomak beat No. 5 Oceanside 2-0 and No. 2 Great Salt Bay beat No. 7 Woolwich. 
Two other quarterfinal games remain to be played as top-seeded Camden-Rockport hosted Searsport on Monday, Oct. 19 at 4:30 p.m., while No. 3 Troy Howard will host No. 6 Wiscasset on Tuesday, Oct. 20 at 3:45 p.m. 
The championship game will be on Monday, Oct. 26 at 3:30 p.m. at Point Lookout in Northport. 
Coaches can report results to Courier Publications/VillageSoup by emailing game information or by sending photos, taken by a smartphone, of the home and away books, to sports@courierpublicationsllc.com. Results also can be reported by calling 594-4401, extension 116. 
Information included in this story is provided by schools/coaches and may not be complete for all teams involved. 
The following is a recap of reported playoff results: 
Coed 
No. 7 Vinalhaven 8, No. 10 Nobleboro 0 
At Vinalhaven Oct. 14, the Vikings blanked the visiting Lions by eight scores. 
M.J. Augusto scored six times in the win for the islanders, while Dreyann Osgood had a goal and Tim Farrelly a goal and assist. 
Joe Hopkins and Robbie Swears combined for the shutout in net for Vinalhaven. 
Boys 
No. 3 Medomak 4, No. 6 Oceanside 0 
At Waldoboro Oct. 16, the Riverhawks soared into the semifinals as they blanked the Mariners. Medomak led 2-0 at halftime. 
Ian Doughty had a hat trick for Medomak, while Arie Vannoy also creased the net in the win. Adam Berry and Zachary Cheeseman logged assists. 
Medomak coach Tenley Libby said Brandon Starr played “a really great game” on defense, which helped keep the Mariners off the board. 
No. 4 Camden-Rockport 7th 2, No. 5 Woolwich 1 (2 OT) 
At Camden Oct. 14, the Schooners got the game-winning score in the second overtime by Austin Ford, on a long direct kick straight on to the goal, as the hosts sailed onto the semifinals. 
CRMS also got a goal from Jeremy Fraser, while Casey Messer minded the net. 
Girls 
No. 4 Medomak 2, No. 5 Oceanside 0 
At Waldoboro Oct. 16, the Riverhawks bested the Mariners via shutout. Medomak led 1-0 at halftime. 
Sadie Cohen scored early in the first half to set the tone for the hosts, while Abby Lash added an insurance goal in the second half for the 'Hawks. 
Medomak coach Andrea Williamson said “a great game was played by all MMS players,” including “Hannah Prock, Abby Lash, Sadie Cohen, Kiya Steltzer, Paige Powell and Taylor Post,” who “fought hard on offense and played very aggressive, winning 50/50 balls and not backing down.” 
Kayla Donlin, Chloe Bossow, Eliza Nelson, Grace Kurr, Hannah Lee and Emily Wotton also played “great defense” on the day, said Williamson. 
Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401.
